title: 108_hr5182
content: The Homeland Security Civil Rights and Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2004 ensures that civil rights and liberties are not compromised in homeland security efforts. It also establishes an Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties within the Department of Homeland Security. Section 705(a) of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to ensure that the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties reports directly to the Secretary, addresses concerns on the basis of race, ethnicity, or religion, and oversees compliance with constitutional and statutory requirements. The Act also mandates the Officer to assist in developing and reviewing Department policies to protect civil rights and liberties. The Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties is responsible for developing, implementing, and reviewing Department policies to protect civil rights and civil liberties. They oversee compliance with legal requirements, coordinate with other officials to address civil rights issues comprehensively, and investigate complaints of potential abuses. The Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties oversees the development, implementation, and review of Department policies to protect civil rights and civil liberties. They coordinate with other officials to address issues comprehensively and investigate complaints of potential abuses, ensuring appropriate reports are provided to Congress. SEC. 813 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 designates a Senior Official to oversee the protection of civil rights and civil liberties by the Office of Inspector General. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security designates a senior official to coordinate investigations of abuses of civil rights and civil liberties within the department and its contractors or grantees. The Office of Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security is responsible for investigating alleged abuses of civil rights and civil liberties by department employees, contractors, or grantees. They ensure personnel receive proper training, consult with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, and provide information on investigation outcomes. The Office of Inspector General ensures proper investigation of civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security. They collaborate with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties, provide investigation outcomes, and publicize complaint procedures and investigation statuses. The Office of Inspector General collaborates with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to investigate civil rights and civil liberties abuses within the Department of Homeland Security. They inform the Officer of any weaknesses or deficiencies in the Department related to civil rights or civil liberties. The Privacy Officer under the Homeland Security Act of 2002 is responsible for coordinating with the Officer for Civil Rights and Civil Liberties to ensure integrated and comprehensive handling of programs, policies, and procedures related to civil rights, civil liberties, and privacy considerations. They also ensure appropriate reports are provided to Congress on these matters.
